results.content:
The presenter is knowledgeable and the content of the course is good but ...
He has broadcast too many mistakes which he corrects throughout the course. But he does not correct them all and leaves the user having to correct themselves - often taking a lot of time to debug.
For example in the final chapter on 'deleting' he programs in a confirmation before delete which asks 'Are you sure you want to delete?'. This does not work and he goes to the final screen and deletes without his program asking for a confirmation. I'm now going to have to debug to find out why.
The way to avoid all this and make the course better would be to have file downloads (perhaps in Github) so that the student can download the correct code and save hours of debugging, both the presenter's errors and the student's typos.
